body: @maosongfu @billonahill Not sure, I just moved those files to a different directory. If you "git log --follow BaseBatchBolt.java" you will hit a different commit by @maosongfu. https://reviewboard.twitter.biz/r/360711/ . IMO it can be removed.

I checked with storm:
https://github.com/apache/storm/blob/master/storm-core/src/jvm/org/apache/storm/coordination/IBatchBolt.java#L26
The reason heron has IBatchBolt<T> is that storm has, so at that time I just want to keep the same as storm for backward compabitliy
But we don't really use "T" now for heron.
OK, I just simplified things and removed the unused T's, which is a safe change since it's not used.

PR #544 removes all warnings from `integration-test` except for `unchecked`.

PR #548 makes javac fail on warnings other than `unchecked`.
PR #549 removes more `unchecked` warnings from c.t.bazel.

Troubleshooting and tuning sections are expected to grow over time. It would be hard to put everything here in one shot.

Please review the format it is written in. Anyone who adds to these guides should follow a single format.

Normally, the config folder contains 7 yaml files:
$ ls -al heron/config/src/yaml/conf/local
total 80
drwxr-xr-x   9 mfu  staff    306 Apr 20 14:58 .
drwxr-xr-x  11 mfu  staff    374 Mar 18 15:07 ..
-rw-r--r--   1 mfu  staff    182 Apr 12 17:24 client.yaml
-rw-r--r--   1 mfu  staff  11270 Mar  7 17:50 heron_internals.yaml
-rw-r--r--   1 mfu  staff   4138 Mar 13 19:11 metrics_sinks.yaml
-rw-r--r--   1 mfu  staff    147 Mar  7 17:50 packing.yaml
-rw-r--r--   1 mfu  staff    569 Apr 20 14:58 scheduler.yaml
-rw-r--r--   1 mfu  staff    404 Mar  7 17:50 statemgr.yaml
-rw-r--r--   1 mfu  staff    379 Apr  4 16:53 uploader.yaml
1. Can u make the example config folder contain all necessary yaml files?
2. Can u make the yaml named consistently? Remove "localfs_" prefix; or add "sample_" prefix for all.

note that - this is not a working cluster. The reason why each file is created with localfs_uploader.yaml or locals_statemgr.yaml is because you can have zk_uploader.yaml later.

client.yaml is optional.
Fair. Then can u add a README to describe this and add also the missing the sample scheduler.yaml?
@ashvina - Just wondering if you need any other help with REEF scheduler, let us know.
@saileshmittal - can you take a look at this?
The travis build.sh mentioned above should also be updated to build `integration-test/...`.
Thanks @kramasamy will try this out without the modifications.
üëç thanks for fixing these, @lewiskan . I'll add some more documentation and add you as reviewer in those.
please check with travis-ci before checking in.

üëç 

I happen to encountered the problem while doing travis check for integration test.

@kramasamy - Thanks for asking !
I have added some unit tests for REEF scheduler today. I am working with our cluster teams to develop deployment scripts and test the implementation.
- Could you please point me at the solution for client classpath. I have not been able to follow all the discussions lately.
- After rebasing on the latest commits, I am getting a new error: `Could not find topology info for topology: AckingTopology, cluster: default and environ: heron`. I am debugging this and will reach out to your team if needed. Please let me know if you are aware any issue related to this.
- Regarding Schduler/AM HA, I have hit an open issue in REEF. This feature might need to wait a bit.
- I am aware of pending tasks and issues. It will help me prioritize if you could help me understand the acceptance criteria for this pull request.
  Thanks!

I'm going to get python bazel linting integrated into bazel. @vikkyrk will get the eggs we need.

@vikkyrk if you could commit the eggs somewhere below `3rdparty/python` (or `3rdparty/eggs`?) and provide a sample command line to test a *.py file I can take it from there on the bazel side.

@kramasamy success, tracker UI launch with /bin/bash automatically. (upgraded to heron v.0.13.5)
step 1: check and save local docker-machine ip address
`$ docker-machine ip default`
for example: 192.168.99.100
step 2: launch image with /bin/bash , specify port address with -p
`docker run -it -p 8888:8888 -p 8889:8889 puffin:u14.04h0.13.5 /bin/bash`
this maps tracker port :8888-> {your-docker-ip}:8888 and ui :8889 -> {your-docker-ip}:8889

step 3: within container, submit heron example (following getting-started guide)
`heron submit local ~/.heron/examples/heron-examples.jar com.twitter.heron.examples.ExclamationTopology ExclamationTopology`

step 4: check running topology UI on local machine
http://{your-docker-ip}:8889
example: http://192.168.99.100:8889/

currently heron-tracker and heron-ui run in background and output to command line. this can be cleaned up to output to file if desired.

Do we require a minimal version of python to build/run heron?
If so, is it feasible that we enforce python >= 2.7 or otherwise throw exceptions? python 2.4 is final on November 30, 2004, really old.

@maosongfu We do enforce python2.7 to build targets and rules. But for attribute 'tools' in the rule of 'extra_action', bazel somehow treats it differently and doesn't use python2.7 provided in the bazel.rc file. Instead, it generats a file using /usr/bin/python.

If we throw exceptions on python2.4, then we will have problems building heron internally at Twitter.

@ashvina - Here are the answers
- I have added some unit tests for REEF scheduler today. I am working with our cluster teams to develop deployment scripts and test the implementation.

This is awesome - will definitely improve reliability.
- Could you please point me at the solution for client classpath. I have not been able to follow all the discussions lately.

Option 1: Add a config in client.yaml and this assumes that the class path is the same across different computers in the organization.

Option 2: Add a command line arg --extra-scheduler-classpath which augments the class path while submitting, activating, deactivating & killing a topology. 

Current thinking is to provide option 1 and if needed provide option 2. Both the options could lead to conflicts. We can solve them when it occurs.
- After rebasing on the latest commits, I am getting a new error: Could not find topology info for topology: AckingTopology, cluster: default and environ: heron. I am debugging this and will reach out to your team if needed. Please let me know if you are aware any issue related to this.

We have not been seeing this issue. Just wondering when and where do you see this?
- Regarding Scheduler/AM HA, I have hit an open issue in REEF. This feature might need to wait a bit.

Can you please elaborate this?
- I am aware of pending tasks and issues. It will help me prioritize if you could help me understand the acceptance criteria for this pull request. Thanks!

PR looks good. It will be nice if you could add a note below review comments that have been fixed. Typically, for the TODOs, we open tracking issues so that we do not drop it.

We don't have strict acceptance criteria. Since community will be very interested in YARN and probably get it into production, it will be nice to ensure some reasonable quality. 
- Include unit tests so that we can exercise regularly
- Include integration tests, if applicable
- Please test in a distributed environment for a few days and see if any issues come up

Let us know if you need help on this.

@nlu90 IIRC, twitter internal has python2.7. Can we forcibly change the version of python on a host (some prepare work on host) before we building heron? For instance, jenkins building allows specification of JAVA or Python version.

After 2.4, python provides a lot of useful features we are very likely to use in feature.
@maosongfu - this is in nest machine - unless /usr/bin/python points to python 2.7, we will have this issue.
this fix is just a syntactic sugar - no change in logic.
@ajorgensen Could u please check whether your S3Uploader can also make use of this utils method?
@maosongfu I am away until Tuesday but I can take a look at it then.

There are a handful of choices for open source foundations for Heron. Last year, we discussed potentially the Apache Software Foundation as a choice and sketched out an initial proposal here: https://github.com/heronproject/apache-proposal
is it ok to release dc names?

No, it is not okay. Thats why I pixelated those. I have checked all in `/website/src/img/` and these were the only two that had some internal info.

If we want to remove them complete from history, it will be a little messy, because one would need to force push the whole repo, including tags, etc, and then others would need to rebase their repo, not merge it.

This is a tool for that (https://rtyley.github.io/bfg-repo-cleaner/). If you think that this is sensitive and needs to be done, let me know and I'll do it. 
cc @kramasamy

Oh I see now. I was looking at the deleted image when I saw the names. Good that they're gone now.

:+1:

In fact, heron does not depend on log4j-over-slf4j.
Heron currently contains those libraries for some twitter specific concerns. We will see whether we can remove them
